content.title: Maternity Benefit Scheme (HBOCWWB)
content.department: Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department Haryana
content.details: The scheme 'Maternity Benefit Scheme (HBOCWWB)' was launched by the Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department Haryana. Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹36,000/- (i.e. ₹30,000/- for motherhood and ₹6000/- for nutritious food) will be given to women registered construction workers after the birth of the child. Further, the benefits under the scheme will be given to women registered workers on the birth of up to two children but is expandable up to the birth of three daughters irrespective of the order of their birth.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹36,000/- (i.e. ₹30,000/- for motherhood and ₹6000/- for nutritious food) will be given to registered women construction workers after the birth of the child.
eligibility: The women worker should be registered under Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB).
The registered women worker should have a minimum of one-year regular membership.
The registered women worker is not eligible for maternity benefits in case the husband is availing paternity benefits from any department/board/corporation.
documents_required: Identity proof i.e. Aadhaar Card, Voter Card
Undertaking that the husband has not claimed the paternity benefit from this board or any other Department/ Board/Corporation.

faqs.question: What is the 'Maternity Benefit Scheme (HBOCWWB)' scheme?
faqs.answer: Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹36,000/- (i.e. ₹30,000/- for motherhood and ₹6000/- for nutritious food) will be given to women registered construction workers after the birth of the child.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department Haryana.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The registered women worker who has a minimum of one-year regular membership is eligible to apply under the scheme for financial assistance after the birth of the child.

faqs.question: Can a general category women worker be eligible to apply under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is for all categories of workers.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for a resident of Haryana State?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should be a permanent resident/domicile of Haryana State.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The financial assistance of ₹36,000/- (i.e. ₹30,000/- for motherhood and ₹6000/- for nutritious food) will be given to registered women construction workers after the birth of the child.

faqs.question: For how many children will the maternity benefit be given to registered women workers?
faqs.answer: The benefits under the scheme will be given to registered women workers on the birth of up to two children but are expandable up to the birth of three daughters irrespective of the order of their birth.

faqs.question: In how many days the application form can be submitted to the Competent Authority?
faqs.answer: It is mandatory to submit the application form along with all the documents to the competent authority within one year of delivery.

faqs.question: Is the woman worker required to submit an undertaking?
faqs.answer: Yes, the woman worker shall submit an undertaking that the husband has not claimed the paternity benefit from this board or any other Department/ Board/Corporation.

faqs.question: How can a construction worker get registered under HBOCWWB?
faqs.answer: For registration, the construction worker should visit the Official Website of the Labour Department Haryana.

faqs.question: Is there any registration fee needed while registering under HBOCWWB?
faqs.answer: Yes, the first-time registration charges are ₹25/- and the registration fees vary according to the renewal time period.

faqs.question: How can an worker apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The eligible worker may apply online mode.

faqs.question: How can an construction worker apply online under the scheme?
faqs.answer: For online application, the construction worker should visit the Official Portal - Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.
